profileText: (Father of Percy Walker and great-great-grandfather of Richard Walker Bolling), a Senator from Alabama; born in Amelia County, Va., August 12, 1783; attended a private school; graduated from The College of New Jersey (now Princeton University) in 1806; studied law; admitted to the bar in 1810 and commenced practice in Huntsville, Ala.; member, Territorial house of representatives 1817, and served as speaker; president of the State constitutional convention in 1819; upon the admission of Alabama as a State into the Union was elected as a Democratic Republican to the United States Senate and served from December 14, 1819, to December 12, 1822, when he resigned; died in Huntsville, Madison County, Ala., April 23, 1823; interment in Maple Hill Cemetery.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Bailey, Hugh C. John Williams Walker: A Study in the Political, Social, and Cultural Life of the Old Southwest. University, AL: University of Alabama Press, 1964.
Owsley, Frank L. "John Williams Walker.'' Alabama Review 9 (April 1956): 100-119.
Watson, Elbert L. "John Williams Walker.'' In Alabama United States Senators, pp. 15-18. Huntsville, AL: Strode Publishers, 1982.

researchRecord.name: 1798-1833. 1 cubic foot. Political and family correspondence, business papers, deeds, legal papers, and printed material documenting his activities in the development of Alabama statehood and service as senator. Finding aid.

recordLocation.name: Alabama Department of Archives and History

researchRecord.name: Correspondence in Alabama governor administrative files, 1817-1825; appointments files, 1821-1825; general records, 1811-1819; collection of records from the Alabama and Mississippi Territories, 1806-1819; and commissions from United States president, 1817-1819.

recordLocation.name: Alabama Department of Archives and History

researchRecord.name: Numerous letters and references in the Samuel Brown papers, 1817-1825.
